DarrenR.co.tt

Electrical & Computer Engineer | Data Scientist

PROJECTS

  • Optimal Impression Calculator for Multi-Stage Advertisement Campaigns on Social Media

(Optimization, Operations Research, Probablistic Modelling, Python, Tkinter)

This calculator was built based on the assumption that within a given Social Network, friends of a given person has an effect on the probability of that person clicking an advertisement. This calculator evaluates a scenario where advertisements are split up between two stages, with the second stage being affected by what has occured in the first stage.

  • eLearn Caribbean - Online Learning Platform for the Caribbean

(Moodle, AWS, Management, Non-Profit)

eLearn Caribbean is an online platform dedicated to providing free education to the Caribbean region. In 2018, 11000 students were awarded no passes in the very critical CXC examination. I am currently creating a Non-Profit Organization based on the overwhelmingly positive feedback received.

  • Realtime Auto Equalizaiton System Based on Acoustic & Visual Feedback

(Digital Signal Processing, Audio Analysis, Image Analysis, MATLAB)

This system was designed and developed to counteract acoustic disintegration of sound waves as they propagate from a speaker to an audience. This was done through the use of Image Analysis to detect the audience & Audio Analysis to examine audio features.

  • Projects at Caribbean Entertainment Technologies

(Agile Development, Project Management, Systems Designing/Creation)

While employed at CET (Caribbean Entertainment Technologies), I worked alongside teams & oversaw projects. These projects are private and cannot be openly displayed. However, the technologies and techniques used in carrying out these projects are discussed such as: Systems Design, Agile Development & Programming Languages.

  • MicroController Based Pulse & Glucose Monitor

(Microcontroller, PIC, C, Sensor Design, Circuit Design, Testing/Analysis)

The created system was able to detect the heart-rate & glucose level of an individual, store the data, and give out an alarm if the heart rate drops below a certain threshold. A keypad & LCD display was used as means of system interaction.
